intro: Dalea guadalcazarensis, commonly known as the Guadalcazar milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are compound, consisting of small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Dalea guadalcazarensis plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
